Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that the portrait of Philippine President Duterte was displayed in Tokyo, when in fact it was digitally manipulated to include his portrait.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or sources to back up the assertion that the portrait was displayed in Tokyo.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the original photo was taken in Jakarta, Indonesia, not Tokyo.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation exists for the claim, which is that the photo was digitally manipulated to include the portrait of Philippine President Duterte.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by providing incorrect information, such as stating the Japanese prime minister's name as "Shinzo Uzumaki Jotaro Abe" instead of "Shinzo Abe".
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the assumption that the portrait of President Duterte was displayed in Tokyo without providing any evidence to support this assumption.
Understate: There is no evidence of understating bias in the provided claim.
